newsitem.title: FRANCE: France toughens cosmetic rules against BSE.
newsitem.headline: France toughens cosmetic rules against BSE.

text.p: France has toughened regulations to protect consumers by prohibiting the sale of cosmetics containing extracts of central nervous systems of ruminants, a health ministry spokeswoman said on Friday.
She said the year-long ban is based on a 1992 advisory "that has largely been observed by manufacturers."

But the government hardened its stance after concerns were raised this year that consumers might be at risk from cosmetics tainted by extracts of cows stricken by bovine spongiform encephalopathy (BSE), or mad cow disease.
Health authorities suspect a link between BSE and the fatal human equivalent, Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease.
The French ban applies to any extracts from British cows.
